thread.title: A Forgotten Striker Is The Top Scoring Englishman In Europe
thread.title_full: A Forgotten Striker Is The Top Scoring Englishman In Europe

title: A Forgotten Striker Is The Top Scoring Englishman In Europe
text:
A Forgotten Striker Is The Top Scoring Englishman In Europe Thu Feb 09 2017 21:11:24   21:11:24 GMT+0000 (GMT) Joe Baiamonte Joe Baiamonte in football 
Remember Matt Derbyshire? He was last seen on these isles last season, scoring eight goals in his second and final season for Rotherham United. 
Well now the former Blackburn Rovers striker has traded the Championship for the Cypriot First Division and is tearing it up for Omonia Nicosia. 
After showing some brief glimpses of promise during his early years at Ewood Park, Derbyshire's career meandered from club to club, with the England U21 international taking in spells with Plymouth Argyle, Wrexham, Olympiacos, Nottingham Forest, Birmingham City, Oldham Athletic, Blackpool and Rotherham before he finally made his way to Cyprus. 
And the 30-year-old forward has taken to the Cypriot top flight like a duck to water, firing in 18 goals in just 20 games to become the top scoring Englishman in Europe, this season. 
Derbyshire's total tally in all competitions is 20 goals, which is the same amount as he managed during two seasons at Rotherham. In fact, the current campaign is the former Blackburn man's most prolific ever, doubling his previous career best tally for a single season. A photo posted by matthew2727 (@mattderbyshire27) on Jan 29, 2017 at 3:17am PST A photo posted by matthew2727 (@mattderbyshire27) on Feb 5, 2017 at 12:41pm PST A photo posted by matthew2727 (@mattderbyshire27) on Jan 18, 2017 at 12:13pm PST 
While the Cypriot first division may not exactly be the most challenging of leagues, Derbyshire has also bagged a couple of goals in the Europa League, this term. 
Come on Gareth Southgate, give the lad a chance. He's in much better form than Daniel Sturridge and Jamie Vardy.
